name: Milanotsava 2019

location.address: Chinese Cultural Centre, 5183 Sheppard Ave E, Scarborough, ON M1B 5Z5

description: 18th Biennial convention of HAA will be held in Toronto Canada during July 5th & 6th (Independence Day weekend) of 2019.

artists.name: Smt. Ratnamala Prakash
artists.bio: Ratnamala Prakash is very well-known in Karnataka for her soulful singing and ability to hit a wide range of notes. She has sung a variety of songs for the Kannada film industry, and was awarded the prestigious Raashtriya Sangeetha Nataka Academy Award in 2017. She is popularly known as Haadu Hakki.
artists.subtitle: Singer

artists.name: Pancham Halibandi
artists.bio: Pancham Halibandi was born in a family of musicians, and had initial training under his father, renowned light music singer Yashwanth Halibandi. He developed an interest in folk, light music & theatre at the age of three. He enjoys the distinction of being a front runner amongst the talented bunch of light music brigade.
artists.subtitle: Singer

artists.name: Ananth Hegde Dantalige
artists.bio: Anantha Hegde is the singer or bagavatha of the troupe. He was awarded for his talent by National Sangeetha Nataka Academy of India, which is a rare achievement for an artist of such a young age. He has been trained by legends of Yakshagana such as Keremane Shambhu hegde and Vidvan Ganapathi Bhat. He is working as a Bhaagavata teacher at the Yakshagana school and has been serving as a professional Bhaagavata for " Idagunji Mahaganapathy Yakshagana Kendra-Keremane " a national award winning Yakshagana troupe in Karnataka.
artists.subtitle: Bhagavataru

artists.name: Shankar Bhagawat Yellapur
artists.bio: Known as a legend of Maddale (mridangam), Shankar Bhagavatha is the most senior member of the visiting troupe and plays Maddale. Known for his imposing presence on the stage and lightning speed hands and fingers, Shankara Bhagavatha is one of very few maddale players who can bring out the best in both singers and dancers. He has a unique ability to express all nine emotions in maddale. He is the most experienced maddale player of our times and is the best in the field. He has won several accolades and has been recently awarded by Yakshagana Academy, Government of Karnataka.
artists.subtitle: Bhagavataru

artists.name: Pandit Gopalakrishna Hegde
artists.bio: Pt. Gopalkrishna Hegde started his musical journey at the age of 8, from his father Shri Govind Hegde Kalbhag and elder brother Pt. Parameshwar Hegde, the well-known classical vocalist. He trained under Shri S.M. Bhat Kattige and has had 15 years of training from Pandit Sheshagiri Hangal. He is a B-High grade artist of All India Radio. He has completed Sangeet Vidwath from Govt. of Karnataka also Sangeetha Rathna from Karnataka University Dharawad. He has performed more than 100 concerts in USA.
artists.subtitle: Singer

artists.name: Anantha Padmanabha Pathak
artists.bio: Known as Yakshaguru, AP Phatak is one of the highly travelled Yakshagana artists. He has visited 16 countries in the last 20 years (including UK, USA, Brazil etc) for Yakshagana performances. He was trained in Yakshagana Kendra Udupi in all aspects of Yakshagana. He has won several accolades from several institutions, including from Bharatheya Vidya Bhavana (UK), Indian embassy in Brazil and University of California Berkeley. He was a part of Yakshagana troupe that toured the world under the direction of Shri Sivaram Karanth, a Jnanapeetha Award winner and noted Yakshagana researcher. He has trained hundred of students in Yakshagana singing and instruments. He is now working as a Yakshagana teacher in Bangalore. He will be playing Chande in the current tour.
artists.subtitle: Chande

artists.name: Ganapati Bhat Thotimane
artists.bio: One of the most prominent and famous of dancers or actors of Yakshagana, Totimane Ganapathy Hegde has the capability to enthrall the audience in whichever roles he enacts. His graceful movements and wonderful facial expressions make him particularly well-known for his role of Krishna, Rama as well as Rakshasa roles. He is in very high demand and is booked for several months in advance for his performances. The winner of several awards and fellowship by Yakshagana academy, he has in depth knowledge of portrayal of characters within the framework of Yakshagana. He was a part of several professional troupes from childhood and is a main artist in "Poornachandra Yakshagana Mandali"
artists.subtitle: Yakshagana Artist

artists.name: Sanjaya Beleyuru
artists.bio: Trained by the legendary Yakshagana Guru "Hosthota Manjunatha Bhagavatha" in Yakshagana dancing, makeup and acting, Sanjaya Beleyuru is known as one of the most promising young artists in Yakshagana. With his imposing physique and wide eyes, he is known for roles of Khalanayaka (villain). He is a part of a 300-year-old professional Yakshagana troupe in his own village. The effects he brings out using shades in facial makeup makes his roles very special and sometimes scary. He is also a costume maker and is in high demand for the Yakshagana costumes he designs and makes. He also runs a Yakshagana training school in his village, Beleyuru.
artists.subtitle: Yakshagana Artist

artists.name: Smt. Radha Desai
artists.bio: Smt. Radha Desai is a Hindusthani classical and light musical artist performing in India. She is an 'A' grade artist of All India radio and Doordarshan Dharwad.
artists.subtitle: Singer
